I disabled anti virus protection for the paul.dll file as well as the LegoCloneWars.exe file and it works fine.  AVG identified the crack and seems to think it's dangerous.  It is a false positive!!!  Again...  There is no virus!!!

Dear Everybody who has been having trouble with installing the game.

1) THERE IS NO VIRUS!
2) So yeah the paul.dll is required.
How to make the game work without the cd-key popping up:

Open the installation folder when you mount the cd. There should be a MAP SKIDROW there. It has two files. paul.dll and SKIDROW. 
Copy these files and paste them into the folder where Lego Star Wars 3 was installed. 
Then..... double click on the SKIDROW Application and either watch the video or just press Escape. 

Now you no longer need a cd-key.
